properties.name: Agudas Israel of St. Louis
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis8202 Delmar Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63124Orthodox synagogue providing a full array of services to our membership. Prayer services three times daily and numerous Torah study classes are available as well as social functions, a vibrant sisterhood and programs for our youth.

properties.name: B'nai El Congregation
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis11411 North 40 Drive, Saint Louis, MO, 63131B’nai El is a family oriented congregation. Through imaginative services, adult education and active sisterhood, brotherhood, youth groups we serve the Jewish needs of all types of families and individuals. Our religious school and B’nai Mitzah programs were recently re-designed to incorporate the latest ideas in Jewish education.

properties.name: B'nai Torah
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis1701 St. Peters-Howell Road St Peters, MO 63376CONGREGATION B’NAI TORAH is a Reform temple serving the needs of the Jewish community of St. Charles and St. Louis counties. More than one-third of the member families are interfaith couples. The congregation is located in St. Peters, Missouri and consists of a sanctuary, religious school, kitchen, office and social hall.

properties.name: Bais Abraham Congregation
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis6910 Delmar Blvd. University City, MO 63130Bais Abraham Congregation, located in the University City Loop area adjacent to Washington University, is an eclectic Orthodox congregation with weekly services and learning groups, as well as regular social, spiritual and intellectual programming.

properties.name: Beth Hamedrosh Hagodol
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis1227 North and South Road St. Louis, MO 63130BETH HAMEDROSH HAGODOL is an Orthodox synagogue in University City. Modern facilities include a sanctuary with seating for 250, social hall and kosher kitchen. The location and dues structure make it especially accommodating for senior citizens. Many services are offered without charge to members and visitors. There is free transportation to the daily minyan. Religious services are conducted using the Traditional Prayerbook (RCA). The synagogue has separate seating for men and women, and a mechitza. Auxiliary organization in the congregation is the Sisterhood. In order to become a member of Beth Hamedrosh Hagodol, one must be born Jewish or a halachic convert. Dues include High Holy Day tickets. Non-members may also purchase holiday tickets.

properties.name: Brith Sholom Kneseth Israel (BSKI)
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis1107 East Linden Avenue, Saint Louis, MO, 63117BSKI is an egalitarian, Conservative Jewish Synagogue in Richmond Heights, next to the Galleria. With a long history and approximately 1000 very warm and friendly members, we welcome you to our synagogue. Our rabbi, Mordecai Miller, well-known all over St. Louis for his warmth, his kindness and his great knowledge, had led our congregation for 13+ years. Attend a Shabbat Service and enjoy our Chazzan, Elliot Portner, whose voice inspires us every Shabbat as well as every holiday. Being a member of BSKI provides a wide array of opportunities for participation in our community and beyond. Our members are very active. Our committees are many and resourceful, and our Women’s League, Men’s Club, as well as out USY and Kadima for younger members, are always on the go. Whatever your preference is, ritual matters, education, environmental issue, services, schools, music, commitment to Israel or almost any other interest, there is a place for you at BSKI.

properties.name: Central Reform Congregation (CRC)
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis5020 Waterman, St. Louis, MO 63108As the only Jewish congregation in the City of St. Louis, CRC has grown to more than 700 households since our founding in 1984. As a diverse and inclusive community, we seek equal roles for men and women and welcome members of interfaith backgrounds, Jews by choice, members of the gay and lesbian community, singles, and people of all ages. With a commitment to people paramount, member participation is a fundamental cornerstone of our philosophy. Our religious services are creative, non-sexist and flexible in both English and Hebrew. Members are free to dress in a manner expressive of their preferences.

properties.name: Congregation B'nai Amoona
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis324 S. Mason Rd., Creve Coeur , MO 63141An egalitarian, conservative congregation, founded 125 years ago, which has a full panoply of activities for all age groups. The congregation sponsors an array of social and educational activities including an early childhood center and two summer day camps. A prayer service is held daily, morning and evening, every day of the year.

properties.name: Congregation Bais Menachem - Chabad
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis8124 Delmar Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63130CONGREGATION BAIS MENACHEM - CHABAD is designed to assist Jews of all ages and backgrounds in attaining a greater degree of spirituality through Jewish awareness and practice. It offers traditional worship services on Shabbat and Yom Tov, as well as on weekday mornings, conducted within a joyous Chassidic milieu. Special emphasis is placed in the areas of outreach to beginners and childrenâs participation. Shabbat morning services are preceded by an hour of study and followed by a delightful Kiddush-luncheon. Sunday morning services are followed by a breakfast and study session. Jews of all persuasions are welcome to attend at any time. The synagogue is a community service offered by Chabad of Greater St. Louis. There are no dues or membership fees.

properties.name: Congregation Shaare Emeth
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis11645 Ladue Rd., St. Louis, MO 63141Shaare Emeth is a caring community – a place of meaningful worship with a dynamic religious school, Hebrew school, preschool and summer camps. We offer stimulating adult education classes and are deeply committed to social justice and outreach to the intermarried and Jews by choice. We always welcome new members.

properties.name: Kol Am
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis1415 Elbridge Payne Rd., Suite 135, Chesterfield, MO 63017Congregation Kol Am is dedicated to participatory worship, intergenerational, life-long learning, Tikkun Olam (social responsibility) and Gemilut Chasadim (acts of loving kindness) through a diverse, warm, welcoming and inclusive congregation where individuals can grow in their Reform Judaism. We are a small congregation that provides a supportive and welcoming Jewish "home" where individuals and families of diverse backgrounds can experience hands-on Judaism in an inclusive and pluralistic setting. We currently offer weekly Friday night Shabbat services; holiday services, dinners and celebrations; and a variety of educational, cultural and social programs. Our innovative Intergenerational Hebrew and Religious School programs are open to all congregants, children and adults. Our youth participate in KABEEY, a joint youth group program offered by Congregations Kol Am, B’nai El and Temple Emanuel. Rabbi Severine Haziza-Sokol will assume her pulpit with our congregation beginning October 1, 2005. Interim Rabbi Amy Bigman will remain with us through the end of October. Kol Am is currently conducting all worship services at Garden Villas West Retirement Community, 13590 South Outer Forty Dr., pending the completion of construction of our new synagogue in Chesterfield in spring 2006.

properties.name: Kol HaNeshama
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis12 Village Drive, St. Louis, MO 63146KOL HANESHAMA, meaning “voice of the soul,” is one of the newest congregations in St. Louis. Kol HaNeshama was founded in April, 2001, by people striving to create a more spiritual community, grounded in worship, education, and social action; and committed to providing a welcoming, joyful, safe and closely knit community. While located in West St. Louis County, this traditional Reform congregation draws its membership from a variety of communities throughout St. Louis and St. Charles counties. Rabbi Lynn Goldstein guides the congregation with her more than 18 years of experience. Rabbi Goldstein is known throughout the country for her leadership in family education and tikkun olam (social action). Kol HaNeshama strives to build a warm and supportive synagogue community. All are welcome to join in our celebrations. Shabbat evening services are held monthly in members’ homes and occasionally, weather permitting, at Faust Park. High Holy Day and Sukkot services are held at Faust Park. Other holiday services are held at members’ homes. All services are free and open to the public. Most services are preceded by a Shabbat or holiday dinner. Our worship services are spiritual, filled with music, casual, participatory, educational, and the heart of our community. Holidays are observed in a creative combination of ways, both traditional and innovative. Please call for the location and directions. There are no dues. We ask our members for voluntary annual contributions. Everyone is welcome.

properties.name: Neve Shalom
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis1240 Dautel Lane, St. Louis, MO 63146Neve Shalom is a Jewish renewal congregation founded in 1989 in St. Louis. We are multi-denominational, combining the best resources of all traditions within Judaism. We believe in living in the whole house. Neve takes an imaginative approach to traditional sources. We stress creativity, individually designed learning opportunities at all levels, a devotion to Hebrew and other Jewish languages, spirit, independent thinking, familiarity with traditional texts, inclusion and dialogue. We teach and inspire through the many Jewish arts that we practice in our sacred space. Study at Neve is arranged both formally & informally. Adult Torah study is held weekly throughout the year. Religious school meets on Saturday mornings and serves students between K-12 grades. The interests of the congregation drive additional teaching throughout the year. Services are held Friday nights and Saturday mornings. Torah study precedes Saturday morning worship. Our Shabbat services are informal, full of warmth, music and spirituality, while grounded in tradition. Our prayer style is soulful; both adults and children appreciate the care we have applied to our liturgy and practice. We are inclusive, everyone is welcome to join us for services and to study torah. Membership is encouraged but not required. Dress for services is casual but we take our teachings very seriously. We also teach and practice what we call the inner practices of Judaism, such as meditation, chant, sacred story and sacred music. Neve Shalom sponsors art exhibitions for individuals who may not have any other space to show their work. We provide a showcase for poets to offer readings and feature monthly concerts of spiritual music. These concerts called, “Jacob’s Pillow” are most often on Saturday nights and feature music, songs, story telling as well as a havdalah service.

properties.name: Nusach Hari B'nai Zion Congregation
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis8630 Olive Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63132The feeling of belonging! Nusach Hari B\'nai Zion (NHBZ) welcomes Jewish families, singles, and seniors to all levels of religious knowledge and observance. Religious, social and educational activities include daily minyan, weekly Lunch & Learn\'s, Shabbos luncheons with guest speakers, social action programs, festive holiday parties, and celebrations and observance of our rich traditions. NHBZ\'s Jewish Discovery Center, library and computer center provide an energetic hub for spirited children\'s programming and a kaleidoscope of adult courses. NHBZ, affiliated with the Union of Orthodox Jewish Congregations, is committed to Torah Judaism as well as engagement with the modern world.

properties.name: Sha'arei Chesed Shul
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis700 North and South Road, St. Louis, MO 63130We are a community shul (synagogue) for all Jews who are looking for a traditional, spiritual Jewish experience in a warm, accepting environment. Our commitment is to enhance knowledge and personal growth within the framework of our vibrant Jewish rituals, traditions and laws. In addition of the main Shabbos services, each week a Shabbat Learners\' Service, appropriate for those with no knowledge of Hebrew, teaches how to be an active participant and get more meaning out of the weekly Shabbat service. The rabbi of our shul is Rabbi Elazar Grunberger, who is always available to discuss any questions or issues you may have.

properties.name: Shaare Zedek Synagogue
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis829 North Hanley Road Floor 1, Saint Louis, MO, 63130Shaare Zedek is a Conservative, egalitarian congregation located in University City, Missouri. Committed to the principles of Conservative Judaism, we maintain a full schedule of daily, Shabbat and holiday services. Educational and spiritual activities include Religious School, Adult Education programs, an Early Childhood Center, Sisterhood, Men’s Club and USY.

properties.name: Shir Hadash Reconstructionist Community
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis5000 Washington Place, St. Louis, MO 63108We welcome all those interested in nurturing their Jewish life and identity. We seek to enrich our lives through study of Torah, prayer, communal celebrations, and working for social justice. As an inclusive and egalitarian community, we welcome all Jews regardless of current levels or past practices of observance. Gay and Lesbian Jews, Jews by choice, minority Jews, and non-Jewish partners are all invited to share in our community. Shir Hadash creates a sense of community and caring through the active engagement of its members in the way we conduct our services, approach social justice opportunities, and integrate music and the arts into our experience of Judaism. As a small, participatory community, we appreciate the involvement of all our members. New perspectives, intellectual curiosity, spiritual exploration, and creativity are encouraged and welcome.

properties.name: St. Louis Hillel at Washington University
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis6300 Forsyth Blvd, Clayton, MO 63105St. Louis Hillel serves undergraduate and graduate students at all St. Louis area colleges and universities. With a mission of maximizing opportunities for Jewish students to explore, celebrate and sanctify life in a Jewish way, Hillel staff partners with students to develop programs that meet students’ religious, social, cultural and political interests. Students participate in an array of leadership development programs, from local initiatives to national conferences. Hillel also sponsors social justice programs, inter-group dialogue opportunities, Israel advocacy and Israeli culture events. St. Louis Hillel participates in birthright israel. St. Louis Hillel is accredited by Hillel: The Foundation for Jewish Campus Life and a constituent agency of the St. Louis Jewish Federation. Feel free to stop in and say hi or get more information, our office hours are Monday-Thursday 9-5 and Friday 9-3, or visit our website at www.stlouishillel.org

properties.name: Temple Emanuel
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis12166 Conway Rd., St. Louis, MO 63141At Temple Emanuel we have created a special community that allows us to connect with each other as a way to connect with God. We are a community of people seeking to be in God’s presence – and do the right thing – within the framework of liberal Reform Judaism. We welcome families and individuals all of kinds and of all styles. We are committed to lifelong Jewish learning. Our worship life seeks to create a warm, meaningful and participatory experience. As a congregation, we are large enough to meet the needs of all our congregants, yet small enough to know your name. Come and see for yourself. You are welcome to visit us at any time, even on the High Holy Days. There is always a place for you at Temple Emanuel.

properties.name: Temple Israel
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis#1 Rabbi Alvan D. Rubin Drive, St. Louis, MO 63141Congregation Temple Israel was founded between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur of 1886. On Rosh Hashanah that year, Rabbi Solomon H. Sonneschein was rabbi of Shaare Emeth, of St. Louis. By Kol Nidre he was the rabbi of a newly created Temple Israel. Those Ten Days of Repentance must have been filled with lively board meetings. Congregation Temple Israel has served the St. Louis Jewish community for more than a century since those rough and tumble days a few blocks west of the Mississippi River. Its clergy have educated generations of St. Louisans, comforted them in times of need, celebrated with them in times of joy and motivated them to serve and bless the entire St. Louis community. Blessed with nearly 1,500 member families, a dynamic professional staff and magnificent facilities, our story is far from complete. Each day we make new history for our families. We have a rich tradition of supporting both Jewish and interfaith causes, such as feeding the hungry, clothing the needy, mentoring school children, transporting seniors and many more worthwhile causes. Our congregation is a spiritual family helping one another and reaching out to those in need. We would love to have you be a part of our history. We call ourselves "Congregation Temple Israel" because we are so much more than a building. We are the sum total of the lives we touch and serve.

properties.name: The Reconstructionist Minyan of St. Louis
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis665 S. Skinker Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63105The Reconstructionist Minyan of St. Louis is a synagogue that operates in accordance with the underlying values of equality, participation, and inclusiveness. We also hold a wide array of educational and holiday activities and operate with a consistent commitment to democratic decision making, openness to the differences within Judaism that make Judaism a great religion, and a willingness to try new things. When you are with us, we promise to do our best to offer a friendly and caring environment and to make sure you do not get lost in the shuffle. Social justice, good music and good food make us who we are. We also like to have a lot of fun. Please join us at every opportunity. We look forward to meeting you.

properties.name: Tpheris Israel Chevra Kadisha Congregation (TICK)
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis14550 Ladue Road, Chesterfield, MO 63017Tpheris Israel Chevra Kadisha (TICK), under the spiritual leadership of Rabbi Aaron Winter, prides itself in its role in West County as a vibrant center for spiritual growth in Torah Judaism. With its growing membership, TICK’s emphasis is on Jewish tradition and education in a warm environment. TICK’s Rabbinical staff now includes two talmudic scholars who are members of the St. Louis Kollel, which enhances the availability of learning opportunities, from group style classes to one-on-one chavrusa style learning, which are available to all. TICK offers a variety of inspirational and educational programs that are designed to meet the needs of every community member. The educational program includes a wide range of Torah classes for men, women and children throughout the week, including Shabbos, with classes in Chumash, Mishnah, Talmud, Jewish law, Jewish philosophy and ethics. In addition to daily classes, the synagogue provides morning and evening minyan services which are conducted daily throughout the year, dynamic lectures, theme dinners, Shabbos dinners, annual festival parties, family programming, active women’s group, Chesed committee, weekly Kiddushes, and an active Shabbos children’s program. Our facility, located by the picturesque Greentrails Lake, comprises of a spacious sanctuary where Shabbos and Festival services are held, a Bais Midrash sanctuary where weekday services and Torah classes are conducted, two kosher kitchens capable of catering to all congregational needs, a social hall, and a library. In addition, our four classrooms accommodate TICK’s youth programs and activities. There is a Shabbos eruv in Chesterfield, which enhances the beauty of the Shabbos atmosphere. President is Scott Andrew.

properties.name: Traditional Congregation
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis12437 Ladue Rd., Creve Coeur, MO 63141At Traditional we seek to combine tradition with modernity, to expand ourselves through education, and to rejoice in ourselves through commitment to family. Traditional maintains a firm commitment to Halacha (Jewish Law). At the same time we wrestle with the application of that tradition to the changing circumstances of contemporary times. We aspire to a high level of participation in Tikkun Olam (World Improvement) and Chesed (Acts of kindness), within both the general and Jewish community. At Traditional, our membership of about 250 families is diverse. We are united in our desire for a sense of community, pride, enthusiasm and love for learning about our rich heritage and the religious expression of our people. We welcome Jews from all points on the religious spectrum and have made provisions for both family seating and separate men and ladies seating in the sanctuary. Traditional\'s extensive educational programs invite all to explore the treasure chest of Judaism. Ongoing Jewish study for children and adults is encouraged as a path to spiritual, ethical and intellectual growth. Traditional Congregation is committed to including children of all ages in Shabbat worship services. While extra effort is extended to make children feel welcome in the synagogue at all times, Traditional also offers babysitting services. Traditional offers everyone an atmosphere of warmth and friendliness. It is our intention to maintain that feeling even as our congregation grows. We hope to always be big enough to serve the community as it deserves to be served, and small enough to know each individual as he or she desires to be known. We are affiliated with the Union for Traditional Judaism headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey.

properties.name: United Hebrew Congregation
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis13788 Conway Rd., St. Louis, MO 63141United Hebrew is a reform congregation with strong traditional inclinations. A preschool offers a variety of programs for children ages 10 months – 6 years. Religious school ranges from kindergarten to 10th grade confirmation and a Hebrew school for students in grades 4-6.

properties.name: Young Israel of St. Louis
properties.description: Posted by Jewishinstlouis8101 Delmar Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63130Young Israel of St. Louis is an Orthodox synagogue that provides religious services and Torah study (Beis Midrash) for its members. All Jews are welcome. Its Women’s Division organizes a variety of social and learning activities and is involved in many charitable causes. Guest speakers, classes in a wide range of Jewish subjects and lecture series are open to the community. There are Shabbos youth activities as well as social events during the year. The synagogue members are also actively involved in many Jewish communal and educational institutions. The State of Israel figures proudly in synagogue programs. The synagogue has an active chesed committee which helps people who require any assistance. Shabbos hospitality is available for anyone wishing to spend a Shabbos with us.
